newsitem.title: THAILAND: IFC arranges Phatra Euro-yen bonds.
newsitem.headline: IFC arranges Phatra Euro-yen bonds.

text.p: The International Finance Corp (IFC) said on Monday it arranged an unrated 10 billion yen, five-year Euro-yen offering for Thailand's Phatra Thanakit Plc with IBJ Asia Ltd as joint lead manager.
The issue represents the longest maturity financing obtained by any Thai finance company from the international bond markets, the World Bank's IFC said in a statement obtained by Reuters.

"This transaction would strengthen Phatra Thanakit by imparting stability to its funding base, thereby helping in the reduction of asset liability mismatches and enabling it to on-lend a part of the proceeds to its private sector clients for longer tenors than has been possible until now, "it said.
Phatra Thanakit said in October that it planned to make this issue.
